method.description: <para>Enables or disables hardware encoding and decoding for audio, if it is available. </para> <para>Defaults to on.</para> <para>This must be called immediately after constructing the <ref refid="classdiscordpp_1_1Client" kindref="compound">Client</ref>. If called too late an error will be logged and the setting will not take effect. </para>

method.name: set_output_device
method.description: <para>Asynchronously changes the audio output device in use by the client to the specified device. You can find the list of device IDs that can be passed in with the <ref refid="classdiscordpp_1_1Client_1a58f864ff0a0c49be34701f8d0f7bcf72" kindref="member">Client::GetOutputDevices</ref> function. </para>

method.name: set_output_volume
method.description: <para>Sets the speaker volume for the current user. </para> <para>Output volume specified as a percentage in the range [0, 200] which represents the perceptual loudness. </para>

method.name: set_relationship_created_callback
method.description: <para>Sets a callback to be invoked whenever a relationship for this user is established or changes type. </para> <para>This can be invoked when a user sends or accepts a friend invite or blocks a user for example. </para>

method.name: set_relationship_deleted_callback
method.description: <para>Sets a callback to be invoked whenever a relationship for this user is removed, such as when the user rejects a friend request or removes a friend. </para> <para>When a relationship is removed, <ref refid="classdiscordpp_1_1Client_1ab8dd47239817ffbe268db4c596de1346" kindref="member">Client::GetRelationshipHandle</ref> will return a relationship with the type set to <ref refid="namespacediscordpp_1a28fc5199b9211c24124c06f30c1d0cbba6adf97f83acf6453d4a6a4b1070f3754" kindref="member">RelationshipType::None</ref>. </para>

method.name: set_relationship_groups_updated_callback
method.description: <para>The <ref refid="classdiscordpp_1_1Client_1a0cd38fcef306a9d9c869129bc7059940" kindref="member">RelationshipGroupsUpdatedCallback</ref> is invoked whenever any user in the friends list changes. This is intended to be the callback used to ensure the friends list is kept fresh. This can be used in tandem with <ref refid="classdiscordpp_1_1Client_1a9f7898d3f3d1ec92b06c662df70746d5" kindref="member">Client::GetRelationshipsByGroup</ref> to build and update the friends list. </para>

method.name: set_self_deaf_all
method.description: <para>Mutes all audio from the currently active call for the current user in all calls. They will not be able to hear any other participants, and no other participants will be able to hear the current user either. Note: This overrides the per-call setting. </para>

method.name: set_self_mute_all
method.description: <para>Mutes the current user's microphone so that no other participant in their active calls can hear them in all calls. Note: This overrides the per-call setting. </para>

method.name: set_showing_chat
method.description: <para>Sets whether chat messages are currently being shown in the game. </para> <para>If the user has the Discord desktop application open on the same machine as the game, then they will hear notifications from the Discord application, even though they are able to see those messages in game. So to avoid double-notifying users, you can call this function whenever the chat is shown or hidden to suppress those duplicate notifications.</para> <para>Keep in mind, if the game stops showing chat for a period of time, or the game loses focus because the user switches to a different app, it is important to call this function again so that the user's notifications get re-enabled in Discord during this time. </para>

method.name: set_speaker_mode
method.description: <para>(deprecated) On mobile devices, enable speakerphone mode. </para> <para><xrefsect id="deprecated_1_deprecated000002"><xreftitle>Deprecated</xreftitle><xrefdescription><para>Calling <ref refid="classdiscordpp_1_1Client_1ac269ab57407e3b83e2bb2d30895e666d" kindref="member">Client::SetSpeakerMode</ref> is DEPRECATED. </para> </xrefdescription></xrefsect></para>

method.name: set_status_changed_callback
method.description: <para>Sets a callback function to be invoked whenever the SDKs status changes. </para>

method.name: set_thread_priority
method.description: <para>Allows setting the priority of various SDK threads. </para> <para>The threads that can be controlled are:<itemizedlist> <listitem><para><ref refid="classdiscordpp_1_1Client" kindref="compound">Client</ref>: This is the main thread for the SDK where most of the data processing happens</para> </listitem><listitem><para>Network: This is the thread that receives voice data from lobby calls</para> </listitem><listitem><para>Voice: This is the thread that the voice engine runs on and processes all audio data </para> </listitem></itemizedlist> </para>

method.name: set_token_expiration_callback
method.description: <para>Get a notification when the current token is about to expire or expired. </para> <para>This callback is invoked when the SDK detects that the last token passed to <ref refid="classdiscordpp_1_1Client_1a606b32cef7796f7fb91c2497bc31afc4" kindref="member">Client::UpdateToken</ref> is nearing expiration or has expired. This is a signal to the developer to refresh the token. The callback is invoked once per token, and will not be invoked again until a new token is passed to <ref refid="classdiscordpp_1_1Client_1a606b32cef7796f7fb91c2497bc31afc4" kindref="member">Client::UpdateToken</ref>.</para> <para>If the token is refreshed before the expiration callback is invoked, call <ref refid="classdiscordpp_1_1Client_1a606b32cef7796f7fb91c2497bc31afc4" kindref="member">Client::UpdateToken</ref> to pass in the new token and reconfigure the token expiration.</para> <para>If your client is disconnected (the token was expired when connecting or was revoked while connected), the expiration callback will not be invoked. </para>

method.name: set_user_updated_callback
method.description: <para>The <ref refid="classdiscordpp_1_1Client_1ad05fa5b49cb55873fdb7e3ad75111fd7" kindref="member">UserUpdatedCallback</ref> is invoked whenever <emphasis>any</emphasis> user the current session knows about changes, not just if the current user changes. For example if one of your Discord friends changes their name or avatar the <ref refid="classdiscordpp_1_1Client_1ad05fa5b49cb55873fdb7e3ad75111fd7" kindref="member">UserUpdatedCallback</ref> will be invoked. It is also invoked when users come online, go offline, or start playing your game. </para>

method.name: set_voice_log_dir
method.description: <para>Causes logs generated by the voice subsystem of the SDK to be written to disk in the specified directory. </para> <para>These logs will be in a file like discord-webrtc_0, and if they grow to big will be rotated and the number incremented. If the log files already exist the old ones will be renamed to discord-last-webrtc_0.</para> <para>An empty path defaults to logging alongside the client library. A minSeverity = <ref refid="namespacediscordpp_1a4b50332ce64ddd00391c442b60c99a35a6adf97f83acf6453d4a6a4b1070f3754" kindref="member">LoggingSeverity::None</ref> disables logging to a file (also the current default).</para> <para>WARNING: This function MUST be invoked immediately after constructing the <ref refid="classdiscordpp_1_1Client" kindref="compound">Client</ref> object! It will print out a warning if invoked too late. </para>

method.name: set_voice_participant_changed_callback
method.description: <para>Callback invoked whenever a user in a lobby joins or leaves a voice call. </para> <para>The main use case for this is to enable displaying which users are in voice in a lobby even if the current user is not in voice yet, and thus does not have a <ref refid="classdiscordpp_1_1Call" kindref="compound">Call</ref> object to bind to. </para>

method.name: show_audio_route_picker
method.description: <para>On iOS devices, show the system audio route picker. </para>

method.name: start_call
method.description: <para>Starts or joins a call in the lobby specified by channelId (For a lobby, simply pass in the lobbyId). </para> <para>On iOS, your application is responsible for enabling the appropriate background audio mode in your Info.plist. VoiceBuildPostProcessor in the sample demonstrates how to do this automatically in your Unity build process.</para> <para>On macOS, you should set the NSMicrophoneUsageDescription key in your Info.plist.</para> <para>Returns null if the user is already in the given voice channel. </para>

method.name: start_call_with_audio_callbacks
method.description: <para>Starts or joins a call in the specified lobby. </para> <para>The audio received callback is invoked whenever incoming audio is received in a call. If the developer sets outShouldMute to true during the callback, the audio data will be muted after the callback is invoked, which is useful if the developer is utilizing the incoming audio and playing it through their own audio engine or playback. The audio samples in <computeroutput>data</computeroutput> can be modified in-place for simple DSP effects.</para> <para>The audio captured callback is invoked whenever local audio is captured before it is processed and transmitted which may be useful for voice moderation, etc.</para> <para>On iOS, your application is responsible for enabling the appropriate background audio mode in your Info.plist. VoiceBuildPostProcessor in the sample demonstrates how to do this automatically in your Unity build process.</para> <para>On macOS, you should set the NSMicrophoneUsageDescription key in your Info.plist.</para> <para>Returns null if the user is already in the given voice channel. </para>

method.name: status_to_string
method.description: <para>Converts the <ref refid="classdiscordpp_1_1Client_1a6f714c5d6aebefa91c1ff8ba97bcce22" kindref="member">Status</ref> enum to a string. </para>

method.name: thread_to_string
method.description: <para>Converts the <ref refid="classdiscordpp_1_1Client_1adadf74b4796b37cf738bdaa61993f0ba" kindref="member">Thread</ref> enum to a string. </para>

method.name: unblock_user
method.description: <para>Unblocks the target user. Does not restore any old relationship between the users though. </para> <para>Fails if the target user is not currently blocked. </para>

method.name: unlink_channel_from_lobby
method.description: <para>Removes any existing channel link from the specified lobby. </para> <para>See the docs on <ref refid="classdiscordpp_1_1LobbyHandle" kindref="compound">LobbyHandle</ref> for more information. A lobby can be unlinked by any user with the LobbyMemberFlags::CanLinkLobby flag, they do not need to have any permissions on the Discord channel in order to sever the in-game link. </para>

method.name: unmerge_into_provisional_account
method.description: <para>This function is used to unlink/unmerge a external identity from a Discord account. This is useful if the user wants to unlink their external identity from their Discord account and create a new provisional account for that identity. This will invalidate all access/refresh tokens for the user and they cannot be used again. </para> <para>This function should be used with the <ref refid="classdiscordpp_1_1Client_1a8003130b6c46e54ac68442483bf0480c" kindref="member">Client::GetProvisionalToken</ref> function to get a provisional token for the newly created provisional account.</para> <para>NOTE: This function only works for public clients. Public clients are ones that do not have a backend server or their own concept of user accounts and simply rely on a separate system for authentication like Steam/Epic.</para> <para>When first testing the SDK, it can be a lot easier to use a public client to get a proof of concept going, and change it to a confidential client later. You can toggle that setting on the OAuth2 page for your application in the Discord developer portal, <ulink url="https://discord.com/developers/applications">https://discord.com/developers/applications</ulink> </para>

method.name: update_provisional_account_display_name
method.description: <para>Updates the display name of a provisional account to the specified name. </para> <para>This should generally be invoked whenever the SDK starts and whenever a provisional account changes their name, since the auto-generated name for provisional accounts is just a random string. </para>

method.name: update_rich_presence
method.description: <para>Updates the rich presence for the current user. </para> <para>You should use rich presence so that other users on Discord know this user is playing a game and you can include some hints of what they are playing such as a character name or map name. Rich presence also enables Discord game invites to work too!</para> <para>Note: On Desktop, rich presence can be set before calling <ref refid="classdiscordpp_1_1Client_1a873a844c7c4c72e9e693419bb3e290aa" kindref="member">Client::Connect</ref>, but it will be cleared if the <ref refid="classdiscordpp_1_1Client" kindref="compound">Client</ref> connects. When <ref refid="classdiscordpp_1_1Client" kindref="compound">Client</ref> is not connected, this sets the rich presence in the current user's Discord client when available.</para> <para>See the docs on the <ref refid="classdiscordpp_1_1Activity" kindref="compound">Activity</ref> struct for more details.</para> <para>Note: The <ref refid="classdiscordpp_1_1Activity" kindref="compound">Activity</ref> object here is a partial object, fields such as name, and applicationId cannot be set and will be overwritten by the SDK. See <ulink url="https://discord.com/developers/docs/rich-presence/using-with-the-game-sdk#partial-activity-struct">https://discord.com/developers/docs/rich-presence/using-with-the-game-sdk#partial-activity-struct</ulink> for more information. </para>

method.name: update_token
method.description: <para>Asynchronously sets a new auth token for this client to use. </para> <para>If your client is already connected, this function <emphasis>may</emphasis> trigger a reconnect. If your client is not connected, this function will only update the auth token, and so you must invoke <ref refid="classdiscordpp_1_1Client_1a873a844c7c4c72e9e693419bb3e290aa" kindref="member">Client::Connect</ref> as well. You should wait for the given callback function to be invoked though so that the next <ref refid="classdiscordpp_1_1Client_1a873a844c7c4c72e9e693419bb3e290aa" kindref="member">Client::Connect</ref> attempt uses the updated token. </para>
